result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherron Sherry Shead

defendant.name: Shead, Sherron Sherry
defendant.address: 2414 North Vel R Phillips Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53212

records.addlTxt: No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10/26/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered no contact with DMG or children. No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sherron Sherry Shead in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date. The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/24/22 @ 1:30p
